p: Figure 2 shows the importance of the viral load at admission for the outcome of the overall population as Kaplan–Meier survival-curve for patients with low, intermediate and high viral loads at admission (panel a). The same analysis split in patient population of Lakka (panel b) and Goderich (panel c) shows how the intermediate line, corresponding to patients with LVL 7.5–8.5, is different in the two settings.
